page.title: 03WILD ANIMALS
page.content: The wildlife in this area is very varied,owing to the contrasting habitats of woodland and open, cultivated land.Rodents such as{rats, {mice,shrews,rabbits}and{hares}are common,as well as{badgers,hedgehogs,} and the widely-distributed{grey {squirrel. Weasels,stoats}and{foxes prey on the smaller animals. There are two species of non- venomous snakes prevalent in this district_the{grass snake}and the{slow {worm.Common}and{sand lizards}have been seen occasionally. There are also four types of deer which exist in the woods _{roe deer, {fallow deer,sika deer}and{muntjac {deer.}All these deer are wild,the{sika and the{muntjac deer}having been introduced more than fifteen years ago.
